laundromat.spacy.list_merger¶

laundromat.spacy.list_merger.merger(doc)¶

Assumes that the lists can contain no more than one duplicate of each entity

laundromat.spacy.matcher_list¶

laundromat.spacy.matcher_list.csv_list_matcher(nlp)¶

Reads csv-files for names and surnames and uses EntityRuler to match to a entity and return to be added to the model pipeline

Parameters

nlp – The Spacy model

Returns

The ruler containing the new pattern rules to be included in the pipeline

laundromat.spacy.matcher_regex.match_func(doc)¶

Uses regex to find patterns and label them with the given label.

Parameters

Returns

The text in doc-format with added entities

laundromat.spacy.regex_formatter.new_entity(label: str, match: str)¶
laundromat.spacy.regex_formatter.regex_engines()¶

Class that calls the different regex classes, and what priority they have. Priority form top to bottom

laundromat.spacy.regex_formatter.regex_formatter(entities: list = None)¶

Formats desired entities such that they can be fed to SpaCy’s entity ruler

Parameters

entities – a list of strings denoting which entities one wishes to include in the model

Bases: object

add_patterns(entities: list = None, before_ner=True)¶

Adds desired patterns to the entity ruler of the SpaCy model

Parameters

entities – a list of strings denoting which entities the nlp model should detect.

confusion_matrix(TEST_DATA, strict=True)¶

Calculates confusion matrix for given data. Only considers whether a token has been labeled and not if it has been labeled correctly.

disable_ner()¶

Disables the NER-model in the pipeline

Enables the NER-model in the pipeline

f1_scorer(TEST_DATA)¶

Ignores data of the wrong format. If this is a problem, use print_scores instead.

pipeline()¶
predict(text: str)¶

Prints the found entities, their labels, start, and end index.

Parameters

text – a string of text which is to be analysed.

print_scores(TEST_DATA, strict=True)¶
replace(text: str, replacement='entity', replacement_char='~')¶

Replaces found entities in the given text with the attendant entity labels, e.g. a name is replaced with <PER>.

returns: the modified text as a string

similarity(text: str, replacement='entity', replacement_char='~')¶
test(TEST_DATA)¶

Tests the model on the given test data. Since identifying sensitive information is more important than identifying it correctly, we utilise both our own custom score and a much stricter F1 score. For our custom score metric, each correct entity represents 1 point. Each token correctly labeled represents 1/n points where n is the number of tokens in the entity.

TODO Case in which one is contained in the other has been simplified

TODO No functionality for which entity label has been applied

Returns

a custom score, and the F_1 score

top_n_nodes(text: str, n=10)¶
train(TRAIN_DATA, labels: list, n_iter: int = 30, output_dir=None)¶

Takes the training data and trains the wanted entities. Also saves the model if a output path is given

Parameters

  • TRAIN_DATA – training data

  • labels – texts with labels

  • n_iter – number

  • output_dir – Where the model should be saved
